title: Add a maximum TOI limit to every ray-cast queries.

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: Fixing this issue is likely to require breaking changes

body:
This is a breaking changes that adds a `max_toi` parameter to every ray-cast queries. This will cause ray-cast queries to return `None` if the time of impact of the ray with the queried shape is greater than `max_toi`.

In other words, if the first hit of the ray with the shape is further than `ray.orig + ray.dir * max_toi`, then `None` is returned.

This PR also fixes the CI build for WASM.

title: First interference with ray

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: Fixing this issue is likely to require breaking changes

body:
# Summary
This PR adds a new method to the `CollisionWorld` for detecting the first ray intersection with an object.

It creates a new visitor called `RayIntersectionCostFnVisitor` which takes in a cost function and applies it for each leaf node in the BVH using the data contained. This visitor is relatively generic and can be used for other cost functions applied to a `BroadPhase`.

The `.first_intersection_with_ray()` method passes in the equivalent of a narrow phase as the cost function which finds the smallest `toi` in the tree.

# What's left:
- There are a few TODO's left in comments that mainly involve traits being more restrictive than I would like. It should be possible to make them more open in the future without a major interface change so maybe not blocking?
- I would like to add a minimum and maximum to the cost function visitor so that it can ignore the values outside the accepted range. I think this should be added as a new members to the visitor struct with default values applied. A new constructor method could be created to set them. Does this actually work without bloating the API too much?
- How optimal is the implementation here? I did a rough benchmark test using an external repo and it seemed to be slightly more efficient with 100 objects or so but it's hard to quantify.

title: Fix point/aabb projection along the x axis when the point is inside of the AABB.
body:
The projection was wrong in the specific case where:

- The point is inside of the AABB/Cuboid.
- The projection being performed is non-solid.
- The closest face to the point is the one with normal `-x`.

In this situation, the computed projection point wrong due to a flipped sign.

title: Use `slice::iter` instead of `into_iter` to avoid future breakage
body:
`an_array.into_iter()` currently just works because of the autoref
feature, which then calls `<[T] as IntoIterator>::into_iter`. But
in the future, arrays will implement `IntoIterator`, too. In order
to avoid problems in the future, the call is replaced by `iter()`
which is shorter and more explicit.

A crater run showed that your crate is affected by a potential future 
change. See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/65819 for more information.

title: Point projection fixes
body:
This fixes:

- Point projection on a polyline with feature retrieval (it was `unimplemented` before).
- Point projection on balls not taking into account their radius #314.

This also adds a test related to contact pair detection mentioned in #310.

Fix #314.

title: Fix collision group documentation formatting, grammar
body: These bullet points were getting flowed together.

title: Run cargo fmt + add a format check to the CI.
body: This also switches the CI to use CircleCI because it is much faster than Travis.

title: Delete the ncollide_testbed.
body:
This has not been maintained for a while now. It is probably not compatible with the latest version of ncollide either, and not checked by the CI. Also this is in many ways a subset of the nphysics testbeds.

Thus I'm discontinuing the development of `ncollide_testbed2d` and `ncollide_testbed3d` in favor of improving the nphysics testbeds.

title: Segment::support_face_toward: clear the output buffer before filling it.
body: The lack of clear did break 3D come collision detections with segments (which includes collision detection with capsules).

title: Small Refactoring
Remove gratuitous indirection from ShapeHandle
body: Fixes #295

title: Fix significant performance regression on the CollisionWorld
body: Because the collision world did not clear the collision object flags automatically, it could end up re-computing contacts between everything at each frame.

title: Implement nonlinear TOI + refactor the query and world modules.
body:
This PR implement nonlinear TOI and improves robustness of the existing linear TOI.

This refactor the `world` module in favor of a `pipeline` module that groups the world, the narrow-phase, and the broad-phase modules together. Moreover, it adds some low-level glue code in the `pipeline::glue` module for performing what the `CollisionObjectWorld` does but with free functions.

This abstracts the concept of collision objects, allowing any data structure to act as a collision object as long as it implements the `CollisionObjectRef` trait. This also adds  the concept of abstract collision object set.

Fix #219.
May also fix other issue, I'll make a triage soon but won't have the time before the release planned today.

title: Remove extraneous Clone bound on ShapeHandle::new()
body:
Tested locally and doesn't cause problems when `cargo test` is called.

This would allow ShapeHandle's to be created in cases where the concrete type of the Shape isn't known, allowing the user to pass in their Shapes as trait objects.

title: Fix support feature computation for 3D ConvexHull shape.
body: This could cause some jitters in some contact configuration involving a capsule and a convex-hull shapes.

title: Fix doc about Cuboid's half-extents.
Allow updating collider collision rules.
body:
Previously contacts would not be removed (and would seem to persist forever) if collision groups or filters were modified to disallow the contact.

This (rustsim/nphysics#55) indicates that this should take significantly more work, but it seems that all the logic was already there and the check to remove contacts was incorrect.

Should fix rustsim/nphysics#55 and fix #164.

title: Fix compilation with rust 1.34.
body: Fix https://github.com/sebcrozet/kiss3d/issues/167

title: Update to the latest nalgebra version
body: Those are mostly renamings of `Real` to `RealField`.

title: Fix parallel ray-cast and tests
Properly chain contact preprocessors.
body: The fact contact preprocessors were not properly chained could result in noticeable jitters when, e.g., a capsule was part of a compound shape used by nphysics.

title: Allow CollisionWorld's NarrowPhase to be replaced
body: This allows a custom `ContactDispatcher` to be installed, making user-supplied `Shape` impls usable.

title: Fix incorrect contact preprocessor application for some shape pairs.
body: Fix https://github.com/rustsim/nphysics/issues/189

title: Adds some setters to CollisionObject and CollisionWorld
body: Successor of #250, without the CollisionGroup or serialization changes.

title: Make public more triangle mesh topological indices.
Implement a special-cases of ray-cast on segment.
body: This also fixes the FeatureId returned when casting a ray on a segment or a polyline.

title: Deformable trimesh and polylines + CD for capsules and heightfield
body:
This PR adds support for deformable triangle meshes and polylines.
It also implements full support of capsules and heightfield, include contact manifold determination.

title: Add workaround for rust issue #27745
body:
This fixes the nightly build.

The newest nightly supports type_id natively resulting in a name collision.
Once 1.33.0 is stable, the trait 'GetTypeId' should be removed in favour of the native function.

title: "boundin" -> "bounding" in dbvt.rs
body: Quick doc fixup

title: Add convenience methods for creating CollisionGroups
body: Provides builder-pattern style APIs to CollisionGroups --- a nice alternative  for many use-cases.

title: "interactinos" -> "interactions"
body: Fix a typo in documentation

title: Interferences with ray test
body: I was trying to use `interferences_with_ray` unsuccessfully. After some debugging I realized I needed to call `update` after inserting the objects for them to be found. I added this test to find the problem, and I think it might be useful for more people to have it in the project.

title: Fix AABB ray-cast
body: Fix #242

title: Properly handle the case where the CompositeShapeShapeProximityDetector is flipped.
body: Fix #241

title: Add discord button
Fix wrong link
Fix benchmarks
body: Fix #236

title: Properly handle the degenerate ball-vs-polyhedron case where the ball center lies on the polyhedron boundary exactly.
body: Addresses https://github.com/rustsim/nphysics/issues/148

title: Update repository links.
body: Fix #231

title: Implement #224
body: I'm thinking maybe `BroadPhaseProximityHandler::handle` should be split up into `start` and `stop`, removing the boolean parameter.

title: Properly deallocate contact ID when a contact manifold generator is removed
body: Fix https://github.com/sebcrozet/nphysics/issues/136

title: Make DBVTBroadPhase::pairs_to_remove obsolete via HashMap::retain().
body:
I was unable to run the ncollide_testbed3d tests due to build errors (not caused by this change).
ncollide_testbed2d passes.

title: Properly remove internal DBVT nodes to save memory.
body: This addresses https://github.com/sebcrozet/nphysics/issues/122
